title: I want to prepare for an IAS but I have no idea where to start. Can you tell me from where should I start and which books to refer? - Quora

response.answer_text: Certainly it can be done. Go to the website of UPSC and download the syllabus for Preliminaries . Then see the previous years question papers. Next go thorough the NCERT Text Books from class VI to VIII all subjects and Class IX to XII of your subjects as if you are revising them. See if some questions of Preliminaries can now be answered by you by referring to NCERT text Books. . Later you will come to know the standard books ( Like Constitution of India, Economic Survey, Law Commission Reports , Important judgements of SC etc.) for each portion of preliminary paper I. For Preliminary Paper II ( Qualifying in nature) you may refer to any book on it from the market which contains subject wise matter and question answers for previous years. In the meantime subscribe to physical copy of at least Hindu Newspaper and if you can afford take Indian Express also. Read Yojana and Front line magazines. You should aim at attempting Hundred Percent Questions in the given time with not more than 10 to 15 mistakes.
